question.text: Identify the reason for photorespiration not occurring in <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> plant

options.text: <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  is not released in  <math><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math>  plant during photosynthesis
intracellular concentration of <math><mi>C</mi><msub><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> is high in bundle sheath
the intracellular concentration of CO2 is low in bundle sheath cells
the intracellular concentration of CO<sub>2</sub> is high in bundle sheath and mesophyll cells

solution.text: Photorespiration is followed when the enzyme Rubisco does not get enough carbon dioxide and is exposed to a higher concentration of oxygen. In C4 plants, bundle sheath cells maintain a high level of <math><mi>C</mi><msub><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> to keep the Rubisco engaged in reducing <math><mi>C</mi><msub><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> and making glucose.
